As for RBG's replacement, multiple outlets </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/09/25/917042249/hold-trump-to-nominate-amy-coney-barrett-to-the-supreme-court?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a></span><span> President Trump will announce today he's selected conservative favorite Judge Amy Coney Barrett. </span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RESTAURANTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/25/nyc-makes-outdoor-dining-program-permanent?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Al Fresco, Always
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Outdoor dining in NYC" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNTI2L291dGRvb3JfZGluaW5nX2luX255Yy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Noam Galai/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">New York’s pandemic-era outdoor dining program will <a href="https://ny.eater.com/2020/8/12/21336334/nyc-closings-lookback-coronavirus-pandemic-2020?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">become permanent</a>, Mayor Bill de Blasio announced yesterday, granting a big win to restaurants and the twinkling lights industry.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>As we all know, the coronavirus sent the dining sector spiraling, because you can’t wear a mask when you’re eating and the spread of the virus is much more prevalent indoors.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>No one knows exactly how many restaurants have closed in New York City, but estimates from August put it around 1,000. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A recent survey showed that almost 90% of NYC dining establishments didn’t pay full rent in August. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In June, the city introduced a program called Open Restaurants, which allowed more than 10,300 restaurants to spill outside onto sidewalks, streets, and public spaces previously not available to them. It was supposed to sunset at the end of October, but the city considers it an invaluable lifeline to the battered sector. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Who’s gonna say it? C’mon, you know you want to</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That famous <em>Game of Thrones </em>quote: “A chill is forthcoming.” While outdoor dining is relatively simple in the summer, it’s a logistical nightmare in the winter. That’s especially true in NYC, where the supply of heat lamps is low and legal barriers around heaters for commercial use remain unresolved. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>London, too, is facing an “unprecedented surge” for outdoor heaters from restaurants and pubs, </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/48bcc56e-230d-3a54-8a1c-c0bcc55cee29?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports the FT</a></span><span>. One heater company exec said demand is up 5x over last year. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some restaurants are getting creative. On the Upper West Side of Manhattan, Café du Soleil installed 18 geodesic tents, or “<a href="https://www.timeout.com/newyork/news/an-upper-west-side-restaurant-installed-space-bubbles-for-outdoor-dining-this-fall-092120?utm_medium=Social&utm_source=Facebook&cid=%7Enewyork%7Enatsoc%7Efacebook%7Eechobox#Echobox=1600725508&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">space bubbles</a>,” to help block winter elements from pelting patrons as they enjoy some antipasti. But most establishments don’t have the resources to go all out like that.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>indoor dining resumes at 25% capacity on September 30, but NYC’s decision yesterday is an admission that partial indoor service alone is not enough to prevent a restaurant industry calamity.</p>

COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/25/international-roundup-covid19-news?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Covid-19 Around the World
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="Pumpkin with a mask" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNDExL3B1bXBraW5fd2l0aF9hX21hc2suanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The U.S.: </strong>Florida Governor Ron DeSantis <a href="https://abcnews.go.com/Health/wireStory/florida-governor-reopening-states-economy-spread-73244205?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lifted all restrictions</a> on restaurants and other businesses as part of the move into Phase 3 of reopening. “We’re not closing anything going forward," he said.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">France: </strong>Only 1,000 spectators/day will be allowed to attend the French Open, which <a href="https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-epidemics-paris-archive-142c3bd9bc0766ba7248ed2511051630?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">starts tomorrow</a> in Paris. Three weeks ago, organizers were preparing to welcome 11,500 visitors to the tennis tournament, but then Covid-19 cases started spiking. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brazil: </strong>Rio de Janeiro <a href="https://www.france24.com/en/20200925-rio-de-janeiro-postpones-world-famous-carnival-over-covid-19?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">indefinitely postponed</a> its annual Carnival parade originally scheduled for next February because of the coronavirus. It’s a huge blow to the city’s economy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Israel: </strong>The government <a href="https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-yom-kippur-israel-holidays-prayer-985daea97bee60990a54d77b83c9b78b?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tightened</a> its lockdown 2.0 ahead of the start of Yom Kippur Sunday evening. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The UK: </strong>The new “<a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-k-s-rule-of-six-covid-rule-poses-etiquette-problems-its-just-incredibly-awkward-11601043995?mod=hp_featst_pos5&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rule of six</a>,” which restricts gatherings outside the house to just six people, is causing all sorts of social anxiety, reports the WSJ. If your friend is hosting a small party...are you making the cut?</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/25/corporate-agitator-trian-investments-takes-stake-comcast?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Trian Fund Management, Maybe
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Do something meme" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNTIyL2RvX3NvbWV0aGluZ19tZW1lLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Toby Howell</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While an investor taking a 0.4% stake in cable and entertainment conglomerate Comcast might not seem newsworthy, it is when that investor is “<a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-25/trian-investment-in-comcast-fuels-debate-on-breaking-it-up?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">corporate agitator</a>” Trian Fund Management. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Corporate agitator isn’t code for the coworker who microwaves fish in the office, it’s how Trian, which has pressured large conglomerates like DowDupont and PepsiCo to break up in the past, is often described.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What needs to be broken up? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Comcast has faced <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/25/trians-comcast-investment-highlights-nbcuniversals-underperformance.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">growing pressure</a> to split its sickly NBCUniversal and Sky media properties from its healthier internet business.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>As a counterargument, Comcast thinks owning content as well as owning the internet/cable pipes to distribute that content is a formula for success. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And with 33% of the company under his family’s control, CEO Brian Roberts isn’t about to get bullied.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Comcast is betting that a) the launch of its new streaming service Peacock and b) airing two Olympics, a Super Bowl, and a World Cup in 2021 and 2022 will quell any agitating Trian might be planning.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMBLING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/25/caesars-apollo-bidding-war-betting-firm-william-hill?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Caesars and Apollo Fight to Be King of the Hill
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Guy in front of TVs" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNTIzL2d1eV9pbl9mcm9udF9vZl90dnMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">U.S. entertainment conglomerates Apollo Global and Caesars Entertainment have approached UK-based gambling group William Hill for a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-25/apollo-is-said-to-explore-purchase-of-gambling-firm-william-hill?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">potential takeover</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What do they see? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After a 2018 Supreme Court decision paved the way for legal sports gambling in the U.S., European gaming companies have placed some huge bets on red, white, and blue, especially in the digital space.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>William Hill, which at its peak in the 1970s owned 14,000 betting locations, has permanently closed 119 shops this year due to increasingly strict </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/2ca82f51-4433-46bb-a208-71bafc5b364a?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">European regulations</a></span><span>, a pandemic-induced drop in foot traffic, and its lack of a digital presence. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Other gambling companies are doubling down online. </strong>Shares of Barstool Sports owner Penn National Gaming jumped 9% yesterday after a strong debut for Barstool’s online sportsbook. Apptopia reports that the Barstool Sportsbook app was downloaded <a href="https://blog.apptopia.com/sportsbook-apps-hit-record-downloads-on-back-of-barstool-sportsbook-launch?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">22.7k times</a> last Monday, topping single-day records from rivals DraftKings and FanDuel. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Apollo and Caesars both think they can bring Hill’s iconic brand into the online age, and in the process, build a meaningful footprint in the growing U.S. market. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
NATURAL RESOURCES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/25/land-mine-clearing-rat-wins-britains-highest-animal-honor?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
All Hail His Great Whiskerness
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="Rat " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNTI0L3JhdC5qcGVnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>APOPO</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Meet Magawa, a heroic, <a href="https://www.apopo.org/en/latest/2020/08/HeroRAT-Magawa-receives-award-for-life-saving-bravery?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">landmine-clearing</a>, African giant pouched rat whose LinkedIn resume would make an HBS alum jealous.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a virtual ceremony yesterday, Magawa won <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/09/25/916892377/hero-rat-wins-a-top-animal-award-for-sniffing-out-landmines?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Britain’s highest animal honor</a>, the first rat to do so in the 77-year history of the award. And in case you haven’t said “awww” enough already, the gold medal that comes with the award “is perfectly rat-sized and fits onto his work harness” according to NPR. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">His body of work:</strong></span><span> Over the last four years, Magawa deployed his sensitive nose to clear more than 1.5 million square feet of land in Cambodia, finding 39 landmines and 28 items of unexploded ordnance. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Magawa’s unquestioned excellence has us wondering, where does he rank among the top rats of all time?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here’s our list:</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Remy from </span><span><em>Ratatouille</em></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UPXUG8q4jKU&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Pizza Rat</a></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>All the R.O.U.S’s from </span><span><em>The</em></span><span> </span><span><em>Princess Bride</em></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Master Splinter from </span><span><em>Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles</em></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Templeton from </span><span><em>Charlotte’s Web</em></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ol>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
</td>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What’s a Saturday business newsletter without a side of puns? Useless as an eggs benny unaccompanied by home fries, that's what. Here are the winners from last week’s caption contest we ran on our <a href="https://www.instagram.com/morningbrew/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Instagram</a> and <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1307077183576436748?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Twitter</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNDYzL2NhcHRpb25fY29udGVzdF9jcmFiLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiJ9" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Jim Kohl</em> </small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Gold medal and recipient of a Morning Brew mug: </strong>“No, sir, I asked for imitation crab, not a crab imitation”<em>—</em>Jon Frisch</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Silver medal: </strong>"Our employees are our moat"—John Pistotti </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bronze medal: </strong>“Entrees? Try me.”—The Strive Blog </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If inspiration didn’t strike this time around, you still have a chance at stardom (and a Brew mug). Another cartoon is coming next week. </p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNew York’s pandemic-era outdoor dining program will \u003ca href=\"https://ny.eater.com/2020/8/12/21336334/nyc-closings-lookback-coronavirus-pandemic-2020?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebecome permanent\u003c/a\u003e, Mayor Bill de Blasio announced yesterday, granting a big win to restaurants and the twinkling lights industry.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eAs we all know, the coronavirus sent the dining sector spiraling, because you can’t wear a mask when you’re eating and the spread of the virus is much more prevalent indoors.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNo one knows exactly how many restaurants have closed in New York City, but estimates from August put it around 1,000. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA recent survey showed that almost 90% of NYC dining establishments didn’t pay full rent in August. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn June, the city introduced a program called Open Restaurants, which allowed more than 10,300 restaurants to spill outside onto sidewalks, streets, and public spaces previously not available to them. It was supposed to sunset at the end of October, but the city considers it an invaluable lifeline to the battered sector. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWho’s gonna say it? C’mon, you know you want to\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat famous \u003cem\u003eGame of Thrones \u003c/em\u003equote: “A chill is forthcoming.” While outdoor dining is relatively simple in the summer, it’s a logistical nightmare in the winter. That’s especially true in NYC, where the supply of heat lamps is low and legal barriers around heaters for commercial use remain unresolved. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLondon, too, is facing an “unprecedented surge” for outdoor heaters from restaurants and pubs, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/48bcc56e-230d-3a54-8a1c-c0bcc55cee29?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereports the FT\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. One heater company exec said demand is up 5x over last year. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome restaurants are getting creative. On the Upper West Side of Manhattan, Café du Soleil installed 18 geodesic tents, or “\u003ca href=\"https://www.timeout.com/newyork/news/an-upper-west-side-restaurant-installed-space-bubbles-for-outdoor-dining-this-fall-092120?utm_medium=Social\u0026utm_source=Facebook\u0026cid=%7Enewyork%7Enatsoc%7Efacebook%7Eechobox#Echobox=1600725508\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espace bubbles\u003c/a\u003e,” to help block winter elements from pelting patrons as they enjoy some antipasti. But most establishments don’t have the resources to go all out like that.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003eindoor dining resumes at 25% capacity on September 30, but NYC’s decision yesterday is an admission that partial indoor service alone is not enough to prevent a restaurant industry calamity.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F09%2F25%2Fnyc-makes-outdoor-dining-program-permanent\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; Three weeks ago, organizers were preparing to welcome 11,500 visitors to the tennis tournament, but then Covid-19 cases started spiking. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBrazil: \u003c/strong\u003eRio de Janeiro \u003ca href=\"https://www.france24.com/en/20200925-rio-de-janeiro-postpones-world-famous-carnival-over-covid-19?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eindefinitely postponed\u003c/a\u003e its annual Carnival parade originally scheduled for next February because of the coronavirus. It’s a huge blow to the city’s economy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIsrael: \u003c/strong\u003eThe government \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-yom-kippur-israel-holidays-prayer-985daea97bee60990a54d77b83c9b78b?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etightened\u003c/a\u003e its lockdown 2.0 ahead of the start of Yom Kippur Sunday evening. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe UK: \u003c/strong\u003eThe new “\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-k-s-rule-of-six-covid-rule-poses-etiquette-problems-its-just-incredibly-awkward-11601043995?mod=hp_featst_pos5\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erule of six\u003c/a\u003e,” which restricts gatherings outside the house to just six people, is causing all sorts of social anxiety, reports the WSJ. entertainment conglomerate Comcast might not seem newsworthy, it is when that investor is “\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-25/trian-investment-in-comcast-fuels-debate-on-breaking-it-up?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecorporate agitator\u003c/a\u003e” Trian Fund Management. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCorporate agitator isn’t code for the coworker who microwaves fish in the office, it’s how Trian, which has pressured large style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eComcast has faced \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/25/trians-comcast-investment-highlights-nbcuniversals-underperformance.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egrowing pressure\u003c/a\u003e to split its sickly NBCUniversal and Sky media properties from its healthier internet business.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAs a counterargument, Comcast thinks owning content as well as owning the internet/cable pipes to distribute that content is a formula for success. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd with 33% of the company under his family’s control, CEO Brian Roberts isn’t about to get bullied.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eComcast is betting that a) the launch of its new streaming service Peacock and b) airing two Olympics, a Super Bowl, and a World Cup in 2021 and 2022 will quell any agitating Trian
